swarmsim.Controllers package#

Submodules#

swarmsim.Controllers.base_controller module#

class swarmsim.Controllers.base_controller.Controller(population, environment=None, config_path=None)[source]#

Bases: ABC

An interface that defines all the methods that a controller should implement :param population: :type population: The controlled population :param environment: :type environment: The environment :param other_populations: :type other_populations: A list of other populations

get_action(self):

Returns the control action for the agents

abstract get_action()[source]#

The get_action method uses the information given to the Controller class to compute the control acting on “Population”. This is the method you need to override to implement your control action

swarmsim.Controllers.shepherding_lama_controller module#

class swarmsim.Controllers.shepherding_lama_controller.ShepherdingLamaController(population, targets, environment=None, config_path=None)[source]#

Bases: Controller

Implementation of the herders control law from [Lama and di Bernardo, 2024] :param population: :type population: The controlled population :param environment: :type environment: The environment :param other_populations: :type other_populations: A list of other populations

get_action(self):

Returns the control action for the herders

get_action()[source]#

The get_action method uses the information given to the Controller class to compute the control acting on “Population”. This is the method you need to override to implement your control action

swarmsim.Controllers.spatial_inputs module#

class swarmsim.Controllers.spatial_inputs.GaussianRepulsion(population, environment, config_path=None)[source]#

Bases: Controller

This class implements a radial repulsion force whose intensity goes like a gaussion Gaussian repulsion

Parameters:

  • (int) (disc_pts)

  • (float) (strength)

gaussian_input(x, y, A=5.0, mu_x=0.0, mu_y=0.0, sigma_x=1.0, sigma_y=1.0)[source]#

This method, given the parametes of a Gaussin and some points where to evaluate the function, computes a 2D Gaussian distribution. Assumption: the covariance matrix is diagonal :param A (float): :type A (float): Maximum amplitude of the signal :param mu_x(float): :type mu_x(float): Average on the first dimension :param mu_y(float): :type mu_y(float): Average on the second dimension :param sigma_x(float): :type sigma_x(float): Standard deviation in the first dimension :param sigma_y(float): :type sigma_y(float): Standard deviation in the second dimension

get_action()[source]#

This method computes a radial repulsion force from the origin, whose intensity is scaled using a Gaussian distribution in a 2D space
